properties.name: Adult's Penn Word Memory Test Delayed Memory
properties.definition_text: A measure of delayed word memory. In the first part of this test, participants are shown 20 words that they were asked to identify for immediate recall (CPW . Now, during the delayed recall, participants are shown a series, one at a time, of 40 words: the 20 study stimuli they were asked to memorize and 20 novel stimuli, completely different from the 20 distracters showed on the CPW. The participantsâ task is to decide whether they have seen the word before by clicking one of four buttons, presented in a 4-point scale: âdefinitely yesâ, âprobably yesâ, âprobably noâ and âdefinitely no,â using the mouse. There is one alternate form of the CPWd: the CPWd-b.
